boardgame.name: Hoard of the Dragon Queen Chapter 7: Hunting Lodge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How to Cut Trolls and Cut Deals in the Mountains.

The first adventure to be published for Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), Tyranny of Dragons, is a great adventure but requires a greater amount of DM planning than others.

That is where this guide comes in – it cuts down on the planning with updated and simple descriptions, fixes and suggestions to make each chapter come alive for you and your players with minimal effort from you – the DM.
boardgame.rpgseries: Hoard of the Dragon Queen Chapter Guides

boardgame.name: Hoard of the Dragon Queen Chapter 8: Castle in the Clouds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How to Steal Wyverns and Break Flying Castles.

The first adventure to be published for Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), Tyranny of Dragons, is a great adventure but requires a greater amount of DM planning than others.

That is where this guide comes in – it cuts down on the planning with updated and simple descriptions, fixes and suggestions to make each chapter come alive for you and your players with minimal effort from you – the DM.
boardgame.rpgseries: Hoard of the Dragon Queen Chapter Guides

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: Box
boardgame.description:
Medium Stout Box (Full Box Printed)

This game was released throughout 2021 in a starter kit and 12 monthly episodes. A box for the whole game has been released through The Game Crafter.

boardgame.name: Tyranny of Dragons: DM Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

How to rule a Dragon Cult and Terrorize the Sword Coast.

The first adventure to be published for Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), Tyranny of Dragons, is a great adventure but requires a greater amount of DM planning than others.

That is where this guide comes in – it cuts down on the planning with updated and simple descriptions, fixes and suggestions to make each chapter come alive for you and your players with minimal effort from you – the DM.
boardgame.rpgseries: Hoard of the Dragon Queen Chapter Guides

boardgame.name: Dead King's Court
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ulkred the necromancer covets the Androma diamonds. An effort was made to smuggle them out of his reach by disguising them as a regular mead caravan from Good Mead to Easthaven. However, Ulkred seems to be a step ahead and has attacked the caravan and taken the diamonds. Now the only one who may know where Ulkred hides is an insane old man who lives beneath the mountains in the Spine of the World. Will you play his games to learn his secrets?

A four-hour adventure for TIER 1 characters (APL 3).
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Rescue from Wonderland
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Rescue from Wonderland

The module is inspired by the story "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland"

Fast and Exciting adventure for group of 3 - 5 adventurers level 5 - 11 (customizable).
For 3-6 game hours.

This adventure can be easily integrated into your current campaign or played as a one-shot.

The module is designed to give players an interesting role-playing experience.

Our adventurers, at the request of their wizard friend, take part in an unusual rescue expedition.

Their task is to get on a previously unexplored plane of existence and find there one specific inventor - who by mistake fell into a dangerous dimension.

The heroes will have to find the legendary Vorpal sword and fight the monstrous Jabberwocky, and the players will have to meet the characters familiar from childhood.

boardgame.name: Elemental Evil - Waterdeep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Red Larch 014; Waterdeep Trip continues the adventure of the Elemental Evil campaign after the conclusion of the published book, Princes of the Apocalypse. This adventure has the PCs traveling from Red Larch to Waterdeep where they encounter remnants of the cults banding together with new allies to try and forge a new path. The resto f the travel allows for several roleplaying opportunities for the players and Waterdeep provides several opportunities for future adventure.

This 16-page adventure is designed for a party of 13th level and provides everything you need to run the adventure. It includes NPC and monster stats for the encounters along with descriptions in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: Elemental Evil - The Marid's Cross
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Red Larch 015: The Marid's Cross is likely the last adventure tied to the Princes of the Apocalypse campaign published by Wizards of the Coast. This adventure does not require the published book and can be used as a side trek for PCs in Waterdeep or another town with a collection of swamps nearby.

This module has the PCs in Waterdeep and invited to a noble gala when it is disturbed by another adventuring party with a map that has a cult symbol upon it and fighting breaks out with wererats attacking trying to get the map. The PCs are brought into a quest to the Selpir Swamps to find the hidden treasure left behind by one of the Elemental Evil prophets.

This adventure is 17 pages in length and designed for 14th level PCs. The adventure contains everything you need to run the module, including NPCs and monster statblocks in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: Essential Phandalin
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Essential Phandalin 001 kicks off a new campaign centered on the Town of Phandalin. This campaign supplements the Essentials Box Set and uses an updated version of the town set a few years after the original box set dealing with the town. This introductory adventure and details of the updated town does not require the box set to use, however, follow-on modules will require it.

This module introduces the updated town and several new businesses and NPCs. There is a new NPC adventuring party that can be used to add to the PCs party or used as a rival adventuring party. Finally, there is a first level adventure complete with maps and monster stats.

This adventure is a 21-page module designed for 1st level PCs and includes everything you need to play in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: Starting Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Essential Phandalin 002: First Quests details and expands upon two of the three initial quests from the Essentials box set. The Dwarven Excavation quest adds a few additional monsters and modifies the trap at the end of the rooms. The Umbrage Hill quest is expanded with an old dwarf tomb under the hill with the intent of stretching the site to a full night of gaming.

This module requires the box set; Dragon of Icespire Peak to be able to use this adventure. This module provides additional resources to play the box set and includes monster statistics, NPCs, magic items and maps that you may need. It is presented in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: Second Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Essential Phandalin 003: Second Quests is a continuum on the adventures using the pre-published box set; Dragon of Icespire Peak, published by Wizards of the Coast. This module helps to detail and expand upon the Butterskull Ranch, Loggers' Camp, and Mountain's Toe Gold Mine quests. The box set is required to play this adventure.

Each quest features some leeway on how the DM can approach each mission and provides all statblocks needed along with NPCs and any new magic items that is suggested. The module is laid out in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: Essential Side Quests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Essential Phandalin series of modules is intended to play with the Essentials Box Set published by Wizards of the Coast and builds upon material found there to create a campaign. This adventure expands on the Woodland Manse and Circle of Thunder quests and provides additional material for the Falcon's Hunting Lodge location.

A lot of each adventure is listing the monster statblocks for encounters, but there is also additional locations, NPCs, and magic items to use for your campaign. The adventure is 10 pages long and provides what you need in an easy to read and easy to print format. It is designed for characters of level 4-6.

boardgame.name: Return to Twin Falls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Return to Twin Falls is a follow-up adventure from the initial adventure found in the Essential Phandalin 001 module. The PCs travel back to the ruined hamlet now that the dammed lake has been drained and must deal with the remaining bullywugs and undead inside the caves found behind the waterfalls looking for a book thought to be connected with the Spellforge in Wave Echo Mines.

The adventure is designed for PCs level 4-5 and provides a map to the caves along with the monster statistics needed to play the adventure. The module is presented in an easy to read and easy to print format.

boardgame.name: NIN
boardgame.description:
The world of Nin places you as a Ninja master vying to control more castles than your opponents.

To aid you in this quest, your clan has mustered their nine best Ninjas - each with their own unique ability.

However, the winds whisper about how the other clans have also
mustered their best Ninjas to meet you in the field of battle. Therefore,strategic placement and impeccable timing is essential to outmaneuver your opponents.

In this game players take turns to play / reveal one of their Ninja cards as an attempt to control castles. When all players have passed, the game ends and check who is controlling each castle. The player who controls the most castles wins the game.

The game includes 2 game variants, team variant and advanced variant. The Team variant allows players to play in teams (but must be played with 4 players) while the advanced variant gives players more depth by adding a new action to the game, Delay.

boardgame.name: Valor & Villainy: Lludwik's Labyrinth – Premium Plastic Token kit
boardgame.description:
Plastic Token kit compatible to Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak and Valor & Villainy: Lludwik's Labyrinth.

The Plastic Token kit replaces the cardboard dice tokens for each player sheet and are more durable. The Set is compatible to both games, but to replaces all tokens for both, you need to have two sets.

Contains 252 tokens:


180 dice (45 white, 45 red, 45 yellow, 45 green)
30 experience
30 +1 markers
6 activation marker for special ability
5 bombs
1 first player marker

boardgame.name: Valor & Villainy: Lludwik's Labyrinth – Playmat
boardgame.description:
Playmat compatible to Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak and Valor & Villainy: Lludwik's Labyrinth.

The mat has to sides, one related to Valor & Villainy: Minions of Mordak and the backside for Valor & Villainy: Lludwik's Labyrinth.

The mat measures 28 x 40" (~ 71,12 cm x 101,6 cm) and has stitched edges.

boardgame.name: Hunters of the Lost Creatures
boardgame.description:
Collect the lost creatures and build the weirdest wildlife park. Will you choose the right hunter at the right time? Cards, fun & puns.

Hunters of the Lost Creatures is a fast-paced people-friendly card game that you can win against your buddies or lose against your 6 year old kid. But winning or losing only depends on your decisions – not on dice or drawing luck. Join the ultimate battle between strategy and haphazardness. But keep an eye on the interests of your competitors and beware of Trolls, Thieves and Turnados.

The basic rules are simple. Secretly choose a hunter for a designated hunting area: Sea, Air, Forest or Plains. He or she will catch a creature for your awesome wildlife park. You get the creature unless another player has sent a hunter to the same hunting area. The shy creatures will hide if more than one hunter is in their area. So think ahead of your opponents.

Will they go for the most worthy creature? Will they try to block the creature you desperately need for a combo? Or will they place an annoying troll or thief in your park?

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Precision Handball
boardgame.description:
A possession by possession statistical replay simulation of handball using cards and dice.

The outcome of each possession is determined by rolling 4 dice; two d6 and two d10. The two d6 tell you the type of outcome, the two d10 tell you whether that outcome resulted in a goal, a miss or a save.

A complete game will take around 90 die rolls to complete, so easily playable in an hour.

Men's and women's Olympic, World and European championships are available as well as national leagues.

boardgame.name: The Trouble in Harwick Haven
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An experimental DCC RPG level zero adventure funnel, strange winds blow over the quiet village of Harwick Haven, peer into the lives of four separate adventuring groups, and see what the fates have in store for them on this day.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Helden Handwerk
boardgame.description:
In Heroescraft, you are the governor of one of the cities of the legendary land of Nidawellir. Mighty heroes are at your service, with whose tactical use you expand the economic influence of your city. Command your heroes skillfully and erect magnificent buildings that will give you both power and fame.

In this exciting, interactive economic strategy game, two to four players compete for supremacy in the region. With clever actions, the players try to get useful resources to expand their cities - often at the expense of their neighbors.

Recognizing the plans of your competitors and thwarting them at the right time for your own benefit - therein lies the key to success in Heroescraft!

Because only those who make the best use of the skills of the heroes and the special privileges of the buildings will win the gripping competition for raw materials, reputation and power!

In order to win, the players must erect a certain number of buildings. Buildings are built by giving up certain raw materials. Raw materials can either be bought in the cities adjacent to the caravan. Or they can be exchanged with the players or with the bank through different heroes. When buying raw materials, the dynamic prices in the market must be taken into account.

boardgame.name: Federation
boardgame.description:
The universe is organized into many federations which trade, intrigue, develop… One of these federations, still not fully developed yet (5 member planets so far) wants a new delegation to join them, but you are not the only one having your sights set on the federation. The Federation challenges you to prove your worth for 5 years. During these 5 years, you must develop strategies, deploy tactics, take the best opportunities but also form the right alliances at the right time… In the end, only 1 delegation will be chosen: the one with the most prestige!

Federation is an interactive Eurogame with innovative double-sided worker placement mechanic..

Federation is played over 5 rounds. Each round is divided into 2 main steps. The first step is player turns where each player plays an Ambasaador's pawn and send a spaceship on a special mission. Once all players have completed their turn, the Executive Phase starts, where players receive their income, fund Major Projects and pass laws.

At the end of the 5th round, the game ends. The Player with the most prestige points wins the game and joins the Federation. In case of a tie, the victory is shared.

Your individual board is composed of the 5 federated actions, 1 spy action, some senate actions and some special senate actions giving prestige points.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Alternate Solarians
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Servants of the Stars!

Get new options for your Starfinder solarians as you unleash an array of new alternate class features like the devastating neutron mote, the versatile broken cycle, and master the solar winds in storm mode. You can unleash these powers alongside new class foci in the sidereal agent and startech savant that give your solarian a whole new direction beyond just channeling the power of the living stars!

boardgame.name: Olympia: Twilight of the Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Become a legend by taking on the god or forging your own legend

Inspired by the myths of Ancient Greece, Olympia is a campaign setting that takes you to a place both unique and familiar.

This book expands on the material from the Campaign Setting and contains:

Discover the history of
Rules to play servants of the Twelve, including Zeus, Hera, Aphrodite, Ares, Athena, and Hermes. And most importantly how to weave them into your adventures, for they are always watching.
Discover the eleven nations of Olympia, each based on one era or location based on myths from every era of Ancient Greece, from the heroic age to the classical age, to the Hellenic age. Here, Homer can meet Socrates and Alexander!
New rules to allow you to create your myths, your own legend
New feats, equipment, spells, and magic items.
New races: from the amazon, to the demigod, to the nymphs.
New character option including a new, unique domain for each of the gods
An expanded bestiary with over 30 new monsters, including Cerberus, the massive Olympian Giants, the mythic titan Opyros, the more mundane hoplite troops, and even the Twelve themselves!


The land of the gods for 5th edition awaits.

boardgame.name: The Crimson Dancer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood and elegance paves the way!

Blood and guts, cysts and plagues; All horrible, disgusting things that afflict the people of the world. But within all matters gross and bloody, there lies a disciplined path of warriors who hew and dash between, inflicting bodily horrors while dancing across their prey; these few are known as Crimson Dancers.

The Crimson Dancer holds the secrets to a new Champion class that specializes in abusing the blood of the foes in different ways; following the path of the Crimson Reaper and unleashing focused destruction, or the path of the Scarlet Dancer and whittling away at many different foes while being difficult to capture. In addition, this book contains options for those who wish to utilize awful magic that inflicts diseases, through the use of new Plague feats and the Plaguebringer Mageknight, a myriad of new Blood Sphere talents, as well as a refreshed take on the Duelist sphere, expanding its repertoire of bloody talents and aiding all who wish to dance with the blood of their foes.

Designed for Pathfinder 1st edition at the Spheres of Power/Spheres of Might systems.

boardgame.name: Relics of Atlantis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“And the island of Atlantis in like manner disappeared in the depths of the sea . . .”

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among these stories is the legend of the drowned island Atlantis.

This book includes the following:

The Relics of Atlantis veil set.
The Demagogue, a voice veil using Truenamer archetype.
The Orichalcum Smith, a constellation using Machinesmith archetype.
Bonus content: Spheres of Power support for the Machinesmith.

boardgame.name: Horrible Horsemen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“I would ask thee, of the men on horse back.…”

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among these stories are the legends of horsemen that bear ill tidings.
This document includes the following:

The Hagknight’s Elements Veil Set.
The Headless Horseman’s Aspect Veil Set.
Signs, a new manifestation type for constellations.
The Four Horsemen Lesser Cosmology.
The Hagknight, a cavalier archetype with limited veilweaving.
The Perilous Rider, a veilweaving and constellation manifesting antipaladin and paladin class template.
The Revelator, a veilweaving oracle archetype.

boardgame.name: Spider's Stories
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Remember well that all stories are Anansi’s Stories.”

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among those stories are those of Anansi. This book includes the following:

The Spider’s Stories veils set
The Griot, an akashic bard and skald class template.
The Storyweaver, a new arachnid skinwalker heritage.

boardgame.name: Red's Peril
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"All the better to eat you with, my child."

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among these stories is the perilous tale of Little Red Riding Hood.

This book includes the following:

The Red’s Peril veil set
The Huntsman, an akashic Ranger archetype.
The Opportunist, an akashic Hunter archetype.
Five new akashic feats.

boardgame.name: Oz Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Follow the Yellow Brick Road!

Enter the world of Faerie, a land where Oz is just one of the many domains you'll visit. This shared universe created by L. Frank Baum includes everything from Oz to Santa Claus’ workshop, from Lovecraft-inspired Dreamland to the gothic mountains of Mulgravia. The entirety of Faerie is mapped out in three dimensions, including the skylands above, the overworld and islands of the Nonestic Ocean, and the underworld below.

This complete campaign setting include 21 species and over 50 new subspecies, 18 new subclasses, 100 new spells, dozens of new equipment and inventions (replacing artificer infusions), over 100 new magic items, 15 new deities, and 30 new monsters.

So what are you waiting for? Grab some friends, your silver shoes, and your little dog, too. Oz Adventures await!

boardgame.name: Diana, Luna, Lucina (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vivid dreams of three beauteous goddesses and a magnificent white stag guide the party to recover a holy artifact...

Introducing a new adventure format, the Sideward Adventure Arc, a story arc adventure that allows the GM to insert the encounters anywhere within their current campaign in any order they desire without compromising player agency or roleplay. The encounters can also be played as a single one-shot style adventure.

Diana, Luna, Lucina (pf2e) is a Pathfinder Second Edition Compatible sideward adventure arc optimised for 4 adventurers from level 10 and up.

The party begin to have similar dreams, visions of a goddess dressed as a Huntress and a glorious white stag. She asks that the party aid her and her sisters in recovering pieces of a holy relic.

Diana, Luna, Lucina includes the following:

6 location specific maps, 6 random encounter maps.
7 custom creatures created specifically for the adventure arc.
1 custom hazard, 1 custom magic item.
Backstory based on ancient pantheon and 16th century liturature.
Gameplay examples.
Each creature has been designed so that it can be printed as a creature card.

boardgame.name: Mother of Destruction
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Katerina Ladon should need no introduction. She’s provided illustrations for a whole host of game companies and has been a regular contributor to Shadow of the Demon Lord and PunkApocalyptic: The RPG and, without a doubt, she has become someone I can trust to deliver the goods when I need for something monstrous and fun. As with the other fantastic artists who have contributed to the pages of Unspeakable Things, I gave Ladon no direction, no guidance beyond telling her to come up with something nice and scary, or something to that effect. Well, she turned over a delicious illustration that combines the erotic with the grotesque, as you can see on the following page.

The image brought to mind the succubus, naturally. A striking feminine form holding aloft a powerless man to use or discard as she sees fit certainly falls within the concept of a fiendish vamp. Yet, her size, the glittering jewels dotting her skin, the exaggeration of her form evoke avarice, wealth, and excess. With “desire” fixed firmly in mind, I wrote this supplement to make the monster a manifestation of masculine desire and the ruin that loneliness, alienation, and unanswered appetite can bring. Let Mister Preswick’s mistress, the Mother of Destruction, wreak havoc in your games as she has on my creativity.

boardgame.name: Minor Magecraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

11 subclasses for the rogue, monk, fighter, ranger, barbarian and warlock that are intended to grant a more magical tilt to them, utilizing the minor magecraft feature that grants a degree of extra customizability to them.

The classes included, including links to purchase them individually, are as follows:

BARBARIAN
Path of the Force Buster - A mana-wielding warrior who bolsters their body using mana and can tear away arcane enchantments.

Path of the Icon - The Icon inspires their allies, protecting them from fright in combat while directing their attacks.

FIGHTER
Beast Possession - A fighter who uses magecraft to allow beast spirits to possess their body, granting them a variety of skills and tactics.

Prana Duelist - Fighters who lean into their magical backgrounds as lesser spellcasters, attempting to make sense of their arcane powers.

MONK
Spiritualist - Trained in the ways of exorcism. Those who uses techniques that turn, reveal, and strike down the undead.

Surging Soul - A wild magic combatant who causes chaotic effects whenever they strike, at great risk to themselves.

RANGER
Eye of Paris - Rangers who adapt their fighting style from a wide variety of options. Exceptional sharpshooters.

Rifleman - Gunners who sit outside the norms of mage society. They are assassins who exploit unprepared enemies.

ROGUE
Mystic Mayhem - Tricksters who can split themselves into a double of themself, existing as both and neither.

Shade Wave - Power lies within the self, and these rogues modify that self by way of their shadow to create a variety of tools and skills.

WARLOCK
Luck Eater - The agent of a being who interferes with the forces of karma and luck, allowing this warlock to modify probability and feed on the luck of others.

FEATURES
Also included in the pack are extra minor magecraft features not present in the Magus class or the individual class documents, which can only be taken by those with the minor magecraft feature. Two feats, minor magecraft and crest fragments, are also included to add this functionality to other subclasses.

boardgame.name: Mystic Mayhem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Themystic mayhem rogue is a "minor magecraft" class, which interacts with the magecraft features of the Magus class. These classes are designed to be setting-appropriate to the material the Magus is used for, while allowing players to utilize other classes and not be tied down to a full spellcaster. More will be made available!

Less proficient in directly utilizing the mystic arts, the mystic mayhem rogue channels magical energy to sharpen their senses in critical moments. Using these talents, they can briefly flicker between two spaces, quickly occupying both places to overwhelm and advance on unsuspecting opponents. This technique is coupled with various arcane rituals they use to utilize limited amounts of magecraft.

boardgame.name: Actualització del sistema 2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Aktualizacja Systemu 2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Android: Netrunner – System Update 2021
System Update 2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
システムアップデート2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
系統更新2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
系统革新2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
시스템 업데이트 2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
boardgame.description: System Update 2021 is a set of over 80 classic Netrunner cards, reprinted with updated NISEI rules and templating and brand-new original illustrations. It is designed as the perfect follow-up purchase for anyone who wants to dive deeper into the game after experiencing System Gateway.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: System Gateway (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)

boardgame.name: Take a Guess
boardgame.description:
What was the diameter of the world’s biggest snowflake? How tall was the tallest man ever? How many pounds does the heart of a blue whale weigh? You don’t know the answers to these questions? You don’t have to!
Take a Guess is a clever combination of party game and quiz game where knowing isn’t everything. The player whose guess is the closest one earns some points; but you can earn some as well by betting on him. Each of the 1 188 questions is a tricky one. So – would you bet on your guess?

boardgame.name: Juriarno Prince no Mitsugimono
ジュリアーノ王子の貢ぎ物 (Prince Juliano's Tribute)
boardgame.description:
ジュリアーノ王子の貢ぎ物 (Prince Juliano's Tribute) is a board game from Japan. Prince Juliano wants to show his love for the princess. She asks for a necklace to be crafted, one part each month, before she will marry the prince.

Players are jewellers in the kingdom, tasked with keeping the princess happy by putting together the clusters of jewels she demands. The players work together, buying jewels, rolling the dice to find out she wants, and then assembling the necklace. If they do well, the princess gets happier, but if they fail then her mood falls. Over 12 rounds, can the players keep her sufficiently pleased to marry the prince?

The game comes with lots of jewels, gold coins and a long presentation box to assemble the pieces.

There is also a variant to make the game more competitive.
user summary

boardgame.name: Dākuhausu: Dark House
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dākuhausu - The Dark House
The floorboards creak even if you try to step lightly. The sound is eerie in the dark interior of the house. The shadows dance away from the light of your flickering candle. Somewhere ahead, you think you see movement. The hairs on the back of your neck stand up, and you can feel a chill spread through your body. Is that the Yokai you came here to vanquish?

Dākuhausu, The Dark House is an introductory adventure for the Yokai Hunters Society ttrpg by Chema González. Or it can easily be converted to be used with any suitable ttrpg you have at hand.

Yokai Hunters Society takes place in Japan during the Meiji era. You belong to a society dedicated to hunting down and vanquish Yokias. In Dark House, you investigate the house of a young couple where the husband is said to have murdered his wife. What secrets do you find? Is the husband guilty, or is there something behind it all?

Dark House is intended to be played as a one-shot or as a start of a campaign. It can be played with rookie hunters or seasoned veterans.

Besides the adventure, you will find three useful appendices:

Information about the Meiji era to get a better picture of the world the hunters live in.
How to set up and play your branch of the Yokia Hunters Society.
Tips and tricks on how too run a horror mystery adventure.

boardgame.name: Mass Burial
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is happening at the towns mass burial site? Bodies are gone missing, and none are the wiser. Can the mystery be solved, or will the "heroes" only care to get away with as much loot as possible?

Mass Burial is a one-page dungeon/adventure written with Mörk Borg in mind. But it will probably work with any rules you have at hand.

boardgame.name: AngerSmash: The Viciously Addictive Card Game
boardgame.description:
AngerSmash is a strategic, set-building card game of bluff, theft & cooperation. Create a cocktail of Anger and Zen to floor your opponents, all the while under constant attack from your opponents.

- Race to build sets of anger and zen cards.

- sabotage your opponents or team up to destroy them.

- Smell victory then watch as it's snatched away.

- High strategy, low cunning and a little bit of luck!

Improve your position round by round, but don’t ignore what your opponents are doing. You must undermine their plans, steal from them and make their blood boil.

How to win: Be the FIRST to build a set of 4 identical Anger cards & a set of4 identical Zen cards. This is called an ANGERSMASH.

But you must prevent other players from achieving ANGERSMASH before you! BloodBoilers let you steal cards from other players. Disruptors give you special powers.

boardgame.name: Dice Kingdoms of Valeria
Würfelreiche von Valeria
boardgame.description:
Dice Kingdoms of Valeria is a Roll & Write game designed by Levi Mote. On your turn you’ll roll six dice – two dice will activate the citizens for all players simultaneously but the other four dice are just for you. Will you hire citizens to patronize the guilds and fill up your treasury so that you can gain scoring options (Yellow Die)? Will you slay monsters for glory and rewards (Red Die)? Or, will you build roads to Domains that give you citizens, gold, monsters, and dice manipulation powers (Green Die)? Then consider how much Magic you have to make everything that much better (Blue Die).

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Roll- or Flip-and-Write Versions of Non-Writing Games

boardgame.name: Belagerung von Valeria
Siege of Valeria
boardgame.description:
Siege of Valeria is a dice and cards castle defense game designed by Glenn Flaherty.

An army of monster-kin has lain siege to your fortress. Wave upon wave of troops assault your castle walls and deadly siege engines bear down upon you. Your soldiers and wizards are assisted by hearty champions as you battle the horde, but time is running out and the walls are starting to crumble.

The game is purpose-built as a solo game. It has a stand-alone game mode and, when you're ready for a real challenge, there's a campaign mode where your performance in one siege affects your abilities in the next battle.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dueling Fops of Vindamere
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter campaign page:

Greg Stolze's newest tabletop roleplaying game puts you in the corrupt, dissolute city-state of Vindamere, but don't worry. You play the best people there, spoiled children of privilege with nothing better to do than pursue swordplay, flirt outrageously, and snack on delicious vol-au-vents. A single game session covers the social year from Ye Midwinter Balle through the prestigious Alle-Valley Fencinge Championeshippe. Your louche elite blade-swanks fall in love, brawl, sneer and engage in truly petty social rivalries.

Imagine a game that's "Bridgerton, only extremely violent" or "extra-horny Cobra Kai, with swords."

boardgame.name: You Have a Friend in Me
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After a terrifying avalanche you wake up less prepared than expected.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 7.

Escape evil yetis, take a sleigh ride from hell, and maybe even wake an army of darkness, what could be better?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Adventures in Babysitting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ceremorph gnome squidling has lost his parents! It’s not normally your “thing”, but you find yourselves looking into his big mopey squidling eyes and you can’t help yourselves. Part One of the Reaching through Space and Time Series of adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters.

Optimized for APL 10.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Hearing the Call
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After the encounter with a strange child and his family, it is time for a little rest in Easthaven. A party of trappers return to Easthaven speaking of attacks by walking dead and large tentacle creatures. Time to investigate this strange report and see what threat it may be to the town of Easthaven.

Part Two of the Reaching through Space and Time Series of Adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters.

Optimized for APL 7.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Battlefield of the Mind
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

One of the rescued townsfolk approaches the adventurers about their capture and being led down into the cavern. She talks of a cavern filled with chests brimming with gold, gems and jewelry–all removed from the captured prisoners. She offers to guide the adventurers to this location for a split of the treasure. Finally, a chance to get a proper reward! Once more, the adventurers head back into the mountains of Icewind Dale.

Part Three of the Reaching through Space and Time Series of Adventures

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters.

Optimized for APL 7.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Thron von Valeria
Thrones of Valeria
boardgame.description:
Thrones of Valeria is a trick-taking and rank manipulation game designed by Matt Jacobs.

Long ago, when Valeria was a fledgeling realm, the five great houses were constantly bickering, stealing, conspiring, and even assassinating each other for the chance to become the wealthiest and most powerful house, allowing one to rise to the throne of the land…temporarily. The game that evolved from their power struggles has thrived among the common people looking for a taste of the antics of the nobility and is now the sort of game travelers play in taverns, for fun and money.

Thrones of Valeria reflects the tug-of-war between the great houses in the earliest days of the Kingdom. When printed, the game will be presented as a traditional card game with a deck made up of five suits of cards numbered 1 to 9, plus three special Jesters. The game will also feature a Standings Board and chunky ""mahjong-style"" House tiles to reflect the relative power of each house throughout the game. A draw bag for the House tiles and an assortment of coins will also be included.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Roaring Corruption
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The people of the Linsholm fear orcs are about to raid their small farming village. For the past several days, they have been seeing orcs in the hills and forests around the village. They don’t realize that something much worse than this small band of orcs is out there. For now, it’s hunting the orcs. But if the townsfolk aren’t careful, they could be next.

boardgame.name: Casts with Wolves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Keep the Wolves at Bay
Sheep have been dying from wolf attacks. Now, the wolves have you surrounded, but have you been thrown to the wolves, or is someone crying wolf?

This one-shot sidequest adventure is designed for 4-5 characters, level 2-3.

Background & Synopsis
The party encounters a woman who shape-shifts between human and wolf form, but she's not a werewolf. That doesn't mean a werewolf isn't lurking nearby.

Tikaani was abandoned by her mother and raised by wolves and now leads her pack. While resting for the night, the party is surrounded by the pack. Tikaani steps in and suspects that the PCs are hunters. She doesn’t trust humans, as they’ve been hunting the pack. Her birth mother is a shepherd who has been hiring hunters to hunt wolves, suspecting that they’ve been attacking her sheep, when in reality, it’s a werewolf, which has also killed two of the hunters she hired. The party must find out the truth, and if they discover that the two women were related, they must decide what to do with that information.

boardgame.name: Tikaani
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tikaani was abandoned by her mother and raised by wolves and now leads her pack. She is challenged by intrusive thoughts and vertigo.

At Wyrmworks Publishing, we believe that the more people have chances to interact with disabled people, the more normal it will become in their lives, the more comfortable they will be around disabled people, and the more inclusive our world will become. To this end, we release a free disabled character to use in your game every week to help your players grow accustomed to disabled people in an RPG setting, allowing them to get used to interacting with disabled people.

boardgame.name: Mission d'espion
boardgame.description: The goal of the game is to find all the clue hidden hidden in the house by a person that will manage the game. Each a the clue will point the "spy" toward the place where the next clue will be hidden. With some of the clues you will also add mathematic or logical puzzle that the spy will have to solve in order to stop a bomb from blowing.

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 31 - The Final Issue
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!

Brought to you by the design team behind 100 Monster Hunts, Legendary Hunts, and The Greasemonkey's Handbook, these easy to navigate supplements are a perfect addition to any campaign theme!

Each issue focuses on a different creature type and are written by a host of talents from all over the DMsGuild, from adamantine best-sellers to new and upcoming authors!

This is the Final Issue of the Monster Hunts Weekly Series.

boardgame.name: Roll Mon
boardgame.description:
Roll Mon is a TCG (Trading Cube Game) for 2 players
Each player build a team (2 units) including 5 special cards that come with units you choose.

Players control units by flipping the cube to do a action After flip the cube. Face of cube that face up will take action. Each unit's cube have very own unique ability: some can draw card very fast some can attack very heavy some can use skill and more.

A player wins the game by reducing the opponent HP units to 0.

boardgame.name: Frozen II: Splash Match
boardgame.description: Fill the game tray with water and try to pick up snowflakes with tweezers and try to collect a set before the timer/water Nokk (horse) pops up.

boardgame.name: Blood & Claw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ravenous hunters stalk the livestock of Hendstock, leaving nothing but gory carcasses. Concerned for their livelihoods, farmers have pooled their scant means to put out a call for adventurers. With the promise of one hundred gold pieces to whoever ends the threat, they beg for a swift resolution.

boardgame.name: Spectre
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each issue of Creature Ecologies covers a different creature with pictures, educational information, and behavioral facts.

boardgame.name: Musical Instruments
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Use one of these instruments and make your performance memorable!

There are many types of instruments in the world, used by various musicians to express their art, from the humble drum to the complex piano-like instrument. With the possible exception of the voice of a creature, each instrument follows one of several types and each of those, in turn, have their way of doing things.

"Equipment Maker #11 Musical Instruments" gives you a series of tables, prompts and ideas, to help bring more details to your descriptions, from a simple sentence description/concept to an overview of the quality of the sound made.

boardgame.name: Cocktails
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you drinking tonight?

Drinks are, for many, but not all people, something to help them relax. Cocktails are one such beverage. A cocktail is often defined as an alcoholic drink consisting of a spirit or spirits mixed with other ingredients.

Not all of these are alcoholic either because some people, for various reasons will not or cannot consume alcoholic beverages.

Some may be innocent-sounding and hit like a brick when consumed, and others are the opposite and sound extremely dangerous but have zero % alcohol.

boardgame.name: Scene Thieves
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Scene Thieves is a theatrical roleplaying game where players collaboratively “write” a play while simultaneously choreographing an elaborate heist in the background.

During the game’s pre-show, players create a band of thieves who use theatrical performances as cover for their crimes. Players also establish broad strokes for the game’s show before writing down a variety of props on notecards. Then, it’s showtime. In Act I, everyone draws prop cards from a pot and incorporates them into the progression of both the play and the heist. At Intermission, players take note of whether the evening is trending towards comedy or tragedy. In Act II, they have a final chance to reverse their fates before the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Curse/Evil Spell Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What spell do you use to to bring down your wrath upon them?

Some spells are created to help, to protect others, to heal them or give them a benefit or bonus of some kind. Then, there are the spells and incantations whose only purpose is to cause suffering, pain and misery... even death.

Their name might be telling you what it does, or be a poetic way of describing the effect. Sometimes even just the name of the spell or curse alone is enough to instil fear in the enemies of the caster.

This Quick Generator gives you a system for creating the names or concepts of spells/curses that are meant to hurt, hinder, or otherwise cause pain and suffering to the target(s). Using the 2 x d100 tables provided, you can generate 10,000 possible evil spells or curse names.

boardgame.name: Stellar Feature & Phenomena Namer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What have you found as you journey through the void?

When travelling through the infinite void of space, if you go far enough, you are bound to encounter something interesting

It could be anything, from a planet with an unusual biosphere, or something best described as a cube that consumes all that comes into contact with it.

This PDF gives you 2 x d100 tables that combined can give you a name or classification for up to 10,000 possible stellar features & phenomena.

Some of the names might be literal descriptions of the phenomena, others a descriptive metaphor and even some might be called what they are because the person who named them was struggling to classify them, used a name they thought sounded good (even though it was very wrong) and it just stuck.

boardgame.name: Creature Concepts - Folklore
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What variant of a being from folklore have you encountered?

The Quick Generator series by Ennead Games is a collection of tables with one simple theme - you don't have to make a lot of rolls to use them. They have 2 x d100 tables and can give you a lot of possible results. Sometimes though, in the making of them, a lot of entries are not included to keep within that concept. Some even have quite a few more possible entries.

This particular Quick Gen gives you some ideas or concepts of entities of folklore , with a focus in this volume on creatures that could be classed as undead, that can be used for new variants of the creature, or, a quick way to describe a new entity that resembles something from myths and legends.

boardgame.name: Arbitrary Collection 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

20 x d20 Helpful mini lists of various subjects

Every week on the Ennead Games blog, normally on a Friday, a helpful list of 20 items is posted. These normally follow no set pattern or theme, unless there has been a request for a particular list, but a few are based off real-world subjects. Some tables are expanded further into full lists or generators, and others work just fine on their own.

The subjects range from names from faraway lands, to what you might call your coins, to weapon names and more. There may be a common theme for the volume, then again, there might not be. They have been brought together into a handy and eclectic collection, a mixture of Fantasy, Sci-Fi and other genres. All you need to use them is a d20.

boardgame.name: Arbitrary Collection Expanded Volume 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The 3rd volume giving 10 x d100 list covering various subjects and genres

The Helpful List Arbitrary Collection is a set of lists with 20 entries per subject matter. The HLACE (The E is for Expanded) series takes that concept and cranks it up a notch by making the lists have 100 entries each.

Much of the content has been created using previous generators that Ennead Games has published, such as the Spell Names and so on. Think of this set as a collection of the result these generators can make, done so you can save time and just get the results, rather than spending time rolling on each of the tables.

As the content here is semi-randomly generated for a mixture of genres, some entries may be more suitable for your games or stories when compared to others.

boardgame.name: Arbitrary Collection Expanded Volume 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

10 more d100 lists created form Ennead Games content

The Helpful List Arbitrary Collection is a set of lists with 20 entries per subject matter. The Helpful List Arbitrary Collection Expanded (aka HLACE) series takes that concept and cranks it up a notch by making the lists have 100 entries/names/concepts/etc each. Each collection is a mixture of genres and themes.

Much of the content has been created using previous generators that Ennead Games has published, an example of that being "Antagonist - Sci-Fi/Modern". Think of this set as a collection of the result these generators can make, done so you can save time and just get the results, rather than spending time rolling on each of the tables.

As the content here is semi-randomly generated for a mixture of topics and genres, some entries may be more suitable for your games or stories when compared to others.

boardgame.name: 'Amusing' Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

400 “amusing” and punny names for your characters.

Anyone who has created a character for a game or story has (or will), at some point, written down a name and then only after it's said aloud noticed that it sounded amusing or punny. They look like regular, typical names at first glance, but the moment the name is spoken aloud you realise that your main antagonist has a name that sounds like something....lewd....or worse...

Of course, there are times when you WANT this to happen. Either your game/story is light-hearted and jovial, full of puns and jokes, or you want to throw people off guard, having the party laugh at the villains' name before they are crushed!

If you fall into the second group - This PDF is for you. 400 names that are amusing, "amusing", punny, funny or downright groan-worthy. Grouped into femme and masc names for convenience, with nothing stopping you from swapping them around and using on whatever character you wish.

And if your players/readers groan when saying the names aloud, well...job well done!

boardgame.name: Colour/Shade Name Maker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

20,000 possible names for variations of colours & shades

For those who run games or make stories, the description of "A Thing", such as shape, size and so on, can be quite important. The colour or shade can be an important detail as well. A bit of clothing that belongs to one particular faction might have one major colour, with another belonging to their deadliest rivals, with the same being said for the natural world, where creatures or fauna have colours to help them hide or as warnings to predators to "stay away!"

This publication gives you a system for picking and naming various colours, from simple ones such as red, green, blue etc., to the more complex names for the colour an artist might need for their grand work!

boardgame.name: Map Feature Namer Elemental Planes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is a common misconception amongst the general population (those who are aware of the elemental planes of course) that the elemental planes are JUST their element. The truth is that yes, the various things there are made from fire or earth and so on, but they, like the material plane, have forests made of fire, halls forged from living earth, water currents so large they could cover cities or buildings made from what can best be described as a solid cloud, all with their populations and civilisations.

And with civilisations, comes maps that show you where certain things are...

boardgame.name: Skeletons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What they are lies within all of us…

A skeleton is defined by some as an internal structure, that protects and supports the body's organs, a framework to which the creatures attaches in some form the rest of its body. It is often one of the last things to decay once the creature to who it once belonged passes on.

In a world with magic and necromancy, these remains can be a useful tool, disposable minions, cannon fodder or something to experiment with.

The CDG gives you a series of tables to help expand on your descriptions of various creatures, to help spark your imagination and give variety to the inhabitants of the stories and worlds.

Note: Whilst there are different types of skeletons, such as endoskeletons, this pdf refers mostly to the type that is found in humanoids and so on.

boardgame.name: Epithets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Helpful List range from Ennead games is a series of lists in PDF format that give you ideas or pre-made results from other generators and tables.

This particular one covers epithets. An epithet is described as : “an adjective or phrase expressing a quality or attribute regarded as characteristic of the person or thing mentioned.”

Here they are divided into two groups/tables. One being, for the most part, positive and the other being , again for the most part, negative.

How and why the character earned the epithet is up to you, but whatever the reason it should be memorable and something worthy ofthe title!

boardgame.name: Karak Goblin
boardgame.description:
Standalone card game set in the world of Karak. The players will once again become heroes – this time exploring dark goblin caves – in the introductory-level deck-building game. The goal is simple – to fight your way through the 3 levels of monster to the boss and defeat him.

This time you will not go with the famous heroes to the underground of the castle in distant Jordan, but to the goblin cave. The goal of the players is to create strong combos from the cards, with the help of which you will fight your way through a number of monsters.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Portals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dungeon Feature series is designed to help you come up with details for features found in dungeons*. This particular volume covers Portals.

A portal is, in many ways, like a door. They both take you to another place once you step through it. The main difference between a door and a portal is that a door takes you to the next chamber, corridor or even outside.

Stepping through an active portal however and you may find yourself on the other side of town, in another country, or maybe even the other side of the world. Some portals can take you even further, to other worlds, star systems or even universes/planes of existence...

boardgame.name: Monsters of Porphyra 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monsters of Porphyra 3 is a book of monster goodness for the new Porphyra Roleplaying Game.

From the introduction:

We are back again with another monster book. This is the third monster book in the "of Porphyra" series and the first book using the Porphyra Roleplaying Game as our base rule set.

boardgame.name: The Daily Jinx (Issue 1 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
The Daily Jinx
Number 1

The dispatch most widespread throughout the kingdom
Summer 1020

boardgame.name: The Daily Jinx (Issue 2 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
The Daily Jinx
Number 2

The dispatch most widespread throughout the kingdom

Autumn 1020

boardgame.name: The Daily Jinx (Issue 3 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
The Daily Jinx
Number 3

The dispatch most widespread throughout the kingdom

Winter 1020

boardgame.name: Where There is a Hole There is a Hole!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where there is a hole there is a hole! is a small whimsical adventure written for the sadly lost in eternity Forest Hymn and Picnic. But it can definitely be used with other systems you have at hand as long as you have fun with it and love talking animals

In Where there is a hole there is a hole! you have to investigate the sudden appearance of a hole in the middle of the village. Who dug the hole and why? Where does the trail of evidence lead you and how will this affect the quite tranquil life in the village?

boardgame.name: The Hand of Destiny
boardgame.description:
Waves of minions accompany an evil monster ravaging the land in the Realm of Shadows. Fight off each wave and defeat the menacing final boss to bring light to the darkness!

The Hand of Destiny is a no-table-needed, solo game played completely in your hands. You'll use your hero's limited strength resources and unique abilities to vanquish foes and move through the deck. Manage your health, upgrade your hero, and play cards as efficiently as possible to win the day.

boardgame.name: A Clave de Candombe
boardgame.description:
Inspired by a well-known rhythmic base, characteristic of South America, the game proposes a gestural and sound dialogue on the constant key of candombe. It contains cards with images that suggest onomatopoeia and others that suggest slogans to energize the game.

Based on the candombe performed by all the players with their bodies, each one of them, identified by a card that assigns him mimicry and onomatopoeia, must call out to other players without missing a beat.

Each player that misses a beat (and does not respond to its assigned name), gains a letter from Candombe. The game ends when one player gets all the Candombe letters, and the players with less errors win.

Promotes communication, attention and coordination are put into play in A Clave de Candombe.


A KEY TO CANDOMBE

On Sundays, in the Río de la Plata, slaves were allowed to rest and meet their relatives and friends, they “called” from one patio to another through the powerful sound of the drums. Thus they were in music, song and dance, to enjoy the meeting. In the rhythmic base of this musical species, the whole game is developed, that is to say that during a game everyone must repeat this sequence to accompany the game.

OBJECTIVE: Create a sequence of calls and audible responses (with onomatopoeia) without losing the rhythm that all the players do (key of candombe).

A card is dealt to each player in full view of all, which will have a gesture with a sound that will represent it. Once everyone has gotten into the rhythm of candombe, the game begins.

The rhythm must never stop!

boardgame.name: Steve Jackson's Sorcery! The Boardgame
boardgame.description:
Steve Jackson's SORCERY! The Boardgame is a fantasy co-op adventure of exploration, tactical combat, and decision-making for 1 to 4 players set in the wonderful world created by Steve Jackson.


The game takes a band of unusual heroes through the unique lands of the Shamutanti Hills, revisiting all the locations of the choose-your-own-adventure book classic, adding and expanding on the original universe with the addition of locations, characters, and quests.



Players pick hero characters from Dragon Knight to Charlatan, each with their own deck of action cards. These cards are then used to overcome obstacles by activating a range of keyword actions such as jumping, manipulation, spotting hidden elements, or stealth.



The same cards contain a wide range of combat maneuvers that can be played in battle to thrust, stab, cut, breathe fire or sidestep enemies, cast spells, or support other players. The game encourages and facilitates group play since heroes will have to support each other with action cards in order to gain the most from each other’s actions and abilities.



Every location the heroes visit is set up on the location board, allowing them to explore its secrets and interact with the many available location tiles and drawing from a range of possibilities in order to decide the best course of action for the group.



Every location in the game contains new challenges based on the core mechanics that are easy to understand and serve to create a variety of puzzles, dungeons, and other interesting places to explore.



While all the iconic locations and enemies are present, the world setting has been expanded in collaboration with Steve Jackson himself to create a unique, excitingly immersive game adventure set in the SORCERY! universe.

boardgame.name: Trodox (Issue 66 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description: contains a Shadowrun scenario (not tied to a specific edition), a short essay on RPGs and politics, and an interview with a prolific collector
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Kai Ellermann interviews RPG collector Tobias Schulte-Krumpen
Role Playing and Politics - the Antagonists?
Salt water, bullets and a few knocked out teeth

boardgame.name: Old North
boardgame.description:
Old North is an area majority game for 2-4 players. Players battle to have the most influence points over several rounds of gameplay by maintaining the strongest loyalties to the four warring Houses in the North.

In Old North, you have no armies of your own. Instead, you maintain a court (or open hand) of five nobles belonging to the four Houses to manipulate and use their armies for your benefit.

Gameplay revolves around a central board containing six important regions in the realm. Occupying these regions are the armies of the four Houses, vying for control of each one. Over the course of the game, players score points for each noble in their court based on it's House's presence and control of the six regions. Controlling nobles in your court that belong to the most dominant Houses on the board will score you the most points - but comes at a cost.

On your turn, you will play a noble from your hand and perform one of over 30 unique actions and events. Playing a noble improves its House’s numbers and advantage on the board, but in turn removes its presence from your court – eliminating its ability to score points. On one hand, maintaining a court of nobles belonging to the most powerful Houses is the key to victory – but that means keeping them tucked away in your court, away from danger and unable to add to their House's strength on the board.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Summoning of Kramdar
boardgame.description:
The Summoning of Kramdar: A strategy-based board game where players compete against each other to call forth an ancient demon of untold terror.

Players take turns to move towards the altar to make a sacrifice to Kramdar, or they can betray their fellow cult members by sending them instead. Players who make valuable offerings earn more points, while less worthy sacrifices may incur the wrath of Kramdar. Be warned, if an opponent can appease Kramdar, the player who sent them to the altar shall be banished to the Valley of Lost Souls. Whoever has made the most important sacrifices and has the most points by the end of the game is the winner.

A game of wits, deception and sacrifice!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Shivers: StoryCrafter's Kit
boardgame.description:
The Shivers StoryCrafter's Kit contains everything you need to take your pop-up adventures to the next level!

The creative Storyteller will find plenty of uses for our poster-sized, intricately illustrated map of Fogmoor Cove—whether as a helpful player prop or as a source of inspiration for further explorations.

In the course of your travels through Fogmoor Manor, your players might just find themselves...well...living impaired! This is the pack for those times when your characters meet an untimely demise but want to keep the adventure going.

This set of Standees includes ghost art versions of all playable characters—including the Deluxe edition exclusive Shep the Dog & Ocean the Cat. You'll also have a spooktacular new foe to chase around the house...inspired by a classic childhood series!

Finally, we arrive at the greatest possibility this kit includes. With a Blank Pop-Up Room at your disposal, you can craft any addition to Fogmoor Manor you can conceive. Will your haunted halls lead to a Spooky Solarium, an Arcane Auditorium, or perhaps a Ghoulish Garden? It's all up to you! This room features our signature magnetic flooring for easy setup and modular gameplay and includes a blank story card to get you started.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

boardgame.name: DreadBall: Pitch
boardgame.description: This durable DreadBall Game Board features full colour glorious artwork depicting the playing field of the far future, complete with Rush Track, Score Track, Sins Bins and Subs Benches.

boardgame.name: Den of the Robber Duckie
boardgame.description: A klepto man duck's den for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: HOODENING
boardgame.description: A Weaponised Fölk Custom for MÖRK BORG

boardgame.name: Deadzone: Mars Attacks Human Faction Deck
boardgame.description:
This deck enables you to field all of your Mars Attacks miniatures in Deadzone, as the Humans invade the Warpath universe!

It contains Mission cards, Battle cards, and stat cards for all of the miniatures from the Human faction.

boardgame.name: Deadzone: Dice Set
boardgame.description: 10 white eight-sided dice

boardgame.name: Conquer The Forest Path
boardgame.description:
Who will make it through the FOREST first?

Contents:
4 Player Pieces
1 Dice
52 Wooden game board pieces

Customizable game board means no two games will ever be the same. Hidden obstacles and adventures await you at every turn!

The object of the game is to travel through the FOREST along the path of woden pieces. The moves are made by rolling the dice to see how far you will move forward and by following the instructions on the wooden pieces with pictures of them.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Target Edition
boardgame.description:
In the 2021 Monopoly: Target Edition game, players browse for Items instead of buying properties. It's about how much one can save in this Target-themed family board game. Players get to explore their happy place with a Target-themed Monopoly token. Choose Target's mascot Bullseye Dog, a shopping bag, a coffee cup, or a shopping cart.

When a player lands on an Item space, they put that Item in their adorable red Target basket. Then they'll buy their items later at Checkout on the Go or Free Parking spaces. When players pick up an Item, they might also pick up Target Circle Tokens. These double or even triple a player's Savings when they check out. Who doesn't love a deal? Compete for the coveted RedCard to double the Savings at Checkout. The player with the most Savings wins!

Includes gameboard, 4 tokens, 4 shopping baskets, 10 Target Circle tokens, 143 Savings tokens, RedCard, 18 Chance cards, 18 Community Chest cards, 2 dice, money pack, and game guide (rules).

—description from the publisher

Note: The game ends when all the Target Circle Tokens have been used; there is no player elimination, and games take about an hour.

Note 2: There was an earlier "Monopoly: Target Edition" released in 2007 which uses standard Monopoly gameplay instead (buying properties, etc.).

boardgame.name: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – High Noon at Gerzenburg Expansion
boardgame.description:
Corps Command: Dawn’s Early Light High Noon at Gerzenburg is a two-scenario expansion for Dawn's Early Light.

Includes:
- A new 11”x17” map
- 40 new counters depicting the American 11th Armored Division, Airmobile troops from the 101st Airborne Division, the West German 27th Panzergrenadier Brigade, the Soviet 171st and 232nd Motor Rifle Brigades and the 23rd Guards Tank Division—a recon battalion and four regiments
- A battle report on the DEL scenario “The High Road” sets the stage for the continuing battle in High Noon at Gerzenburg

This expansion was released separately from the game and included in the Line of Fire Issue #10 and later incorporated into the 2nd edition Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer game.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer
